paper_title.en: NEXAFS study on substrate temperature dependence of DLC films formed by Ar cluster ion beam assisted deposition

description.en: For the optimization of the synthesis condition of the production of diamond-like carbon (DLC) thin films by Ar gas cluster ion beam (GCIB) assisted deposition of fullerene, the local structure of DLC thin films was investigated by measuring near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectra of the carbon K-edge over the excitation energy range 275-320 eV, using synchrotron radiation. The DLC thin films were formed by GCIB assisted deposition at substrate temperatures ranging from room temperature to 250 degreesC. The sp(2) content estimated from the analysis of the peak corresponding to the transition of the excitation electron from a carbon 1s orbital to a pi* orbital was found to increase with the substrate temperature during GCIB assisted deposition. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: Influence of residual Ar+ in Ar cluster ion beam for DLC film formation

description.en: In order to study the influences of residual Ar monomer ion (Ar+) on sp(2) content and hardness of diamond like carbon (DLC) films formed by Ar cluster ion beam assisted deposition, Ar cluster ion, Ar+ and their mixed ions (Ar cluster ion and Ar+) bombardments were performed during evaporation of C-60. From near edge X-ray absorption fine structure (NEXAFS) and Raman spectroscopy measurements, lower sp(2) content in the carbon films was obtained with Ar cluster ion bombardment than that with Ar+ and mixed ion. Furthermore higher hardness and smooth surface were shown with Ar cluster ion bombardments. Therefore it was important to reduce Ar+ in Ar cluster ion beams to obtain hard DLC films with flat surface. (C) 2003 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

paper_title.en: NEXAFS study on substrate temperature dependence of DLC films formed by Ar cluster ion beam assisted deposition

description.en: For the optimization of the synthesis condition of the production of diamond-like carbon (DLC) thin films by Ar gas cluster ion beam (GCIB) assisted deposition of fullerene, the local structure of DLC thin films was investigated by measuring near-edge X-ray absorption fine structure spectra of the carbon K-edge over the excitation energy range 275-320 eV, using synchrotron radiation. The DLC thin films were formed by GCIB assisted deposition at substrate temperatures ranging from room temperature to 250 degreesC. publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION B-BEAM INTERACTIONS WITH MATERIALS AND ATOMS

description.en: Precipitations in Mg-Li-Zn ternary alloys containing 4 to 13%Li and 4 to 5%Zn (in mass%) with alpha or beta single phase, or with (alpha + beta) dual phases were investigated using a micro-Vickers hardness measurement and transmission electron microscopy. Age hardening in the alpha phase alloy was found to occur, which was attributed to the precipitation of the stable theta (MgLiZn) phase with the following orientation relationships: [ 1010](alpha) \\ [110](theta'), (0001)(alpha) \\ (1 (1) over bar(1) over bar)(theta'). In the (alpha + beta) phases alloy, the precipitation of the alpha phase together with the metastable theta' (MgLi2Zn) phase occurred at grain boundaries between the alpha and beta, and also beta and P grains. The orientation relationships between the alpha and theta' were as follows; (0001)(alpha) \\ (01 (1) over bar)(theta'), [0 (1) over bar 10](alpha) \\ [111](theta'). Age hardening in the beta alloy was caused by the precipitation of the theta' phase and over-aging was attributed to the precipitation of the alpha and theta phases.

Precipitations in Mg-Li-Zn ternary alloys containing 4 to 13%Li and 4 to 5%Zn (in mass%) with alpha or beta single phase, or with (alpha + beta) dual phases were investigated using a micro-Vickers hardness measurement and transmission electron microscopy. Age hardening in the alpha phase alloy was found to occur, which was attributed to the precipitation of the stable theta (MgLiZn) phase with the following orientation relationships: [ 1010](alpha) \\ [110](theta'), (0001)(alpha) \\ (1 (1) over bar(1) over bar)(theta'). In the (alpha + beta) phases alloy, the precipitation of the alpha phase together with the metastable theta' (MgLi2Zn) phase occurred at grain boundaries between the alpha and beta, and also beta and P grains. The orientation relationships between the alpha and theta' were as follows; (0001)(alpha) \\ (01 (1) over bar)(theta'), [0 (1) over bar 10](alpha) \\ [111](theta'). Age hardening in the beta alloy was caused by the precipitation of the theta' phase and over-aging was attributed to the precipitation of the alpha and theta phases.

paper_title.en: Hard DLC film formation by gas cluster ion beam assisted deposition

description.en: Diamond-like carbon (DLC) films with high hardness were formed by Ar cluster ion beam assisted deposition at room temperature, using C60 as a carbon source. The gas cluster ion beam (GCIB) assisted deposition was useful to form hard DLC films, as the bombardments induced high-pressure and high-temperature effects at the impact surface, and ultra low energy effects. When the acceleration energy of Ar cluster ion was 5 keV, the hardness of 50 GPa was obtained. This value was approximately two times higher than that of the films deposited with conventional methods. Wear-resistance properties were also higher than that of conventional films. Rough estimations of sp2 orbital in the films were carried out with Raman spectra, the films formed with Ar cluster ion bombardment had lower sp2 contents, which meant films had low fraction of graphite bonding. Thus DLC films exhibiting higher physical characteristics and lower graphite bonding were obtained with GCIB assisted deposition. © 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: Nuclear Instruments and Methods in Physics Research, Section B: Beam Interactions with Materials and Atoms
